definitions.definition: A state of dependence; a refusal to exercise initiative.
examples: Frank's sullen dependency was driving his father nuts.

definitions.definition: Something dependent on, or subordinate to, something else:
examples: In the United States' governmental structure, the military is conceived as a dependency under the executive branch.

definitions.definition: The status of being a legal dependent ; the relationship between a dependent and their provider .
A colony , or a territory subject to rule by an external power .
A dependence on a habit - forming substance such as a drug or alcohol .
Reliance on the functionality provided by some other, external component .
examples: This library has dependencies on a lot of other libraries. We have to compile all of those other libraries first.

definitions.definition: An external component whose functionality is relied on.
examples: One of this library's dependencies is very finicky. It can be hard to get it to compile on some systems.

main_definition: A state of dependence; a refusal to exercise initiative.
secondary_definitions: Something dependent on, or subordinate to, something else:
The status of being a legal dependent ; the relationship between a dependent and their provider .
A colony , or a territory subject to rule by an external power .
A dependence on a habit - forming substance such as a drug or alcohol .
( computing ) Reliance on the functionality provided by some other, external component .
( computing ) An external component whose functionality is relied on.
